content.description: Start on the large opposing crimps on the face with feet on the small ground level flakes. Look for the crimp on the X and a big crystal knob and work up the middle of the face.
content.protection: Watch out for the pointy rock under the top part of this problem. It gets easier as you get to the top but I'd hate to fall on that. Also my pad kept sliding down the hill, but the harder moves are low.
content.location: To the left of the Nest C outcrop

content.description: Sit start low on the right side with hands on a flake. Traverse left, then climb up and top out at the pointy apex.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6KaZNtqA-w
content.location: In Nest B on a smaller rock face across from the main boulder.

content.description: Sit start using a crimp and a right facing sidepull to move up to the hollow-feeling flake and climb the slightly overhung face of this short boulder. I'm not sure of the actual name of this problem or FA info, but there was chalk on the holds when I first saw it so I can't be the first one here.
content.protection: Good landing on a short problem. One pad is enough.
content.location: In front of and to the left of the Nest C boulder

content.description: Without using the crack or the detached block to the right, walk up the ramp to a good right sidepull.  Using a far left crimp, step up on thin crystals and make a long move to the big flake, then finish on The Crescent Flake.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a spotter, or set a top rope
content.location: Right end of the Nest B slab

content.description: Climb the wide crack to the top of the detached block right of the slab, then scramble to the top.
content.location: Left end of Nest B slab

content.description: Sit Start with the big pebble and a pocket to climb up into the big seam where the roof meets the bottom section of rock. Find any one of the undercling crimps on the roof and feel around for holds underneath and to the right of the ferns to top out with.It's probably a good idea to scope the upper section from the top for holds before you get up there because you can't see from underneath.
content.protection:
Good flat landing, but a spotter would be nice in case you fall back off the roof. 

  BE SURE TO CHECK the seam/shelf where the roof meets the bottom section of boulder for broken glass before you stick your hand there. I took all of it off the shelf when I was there but I guess the local partiers enjoy throwing glass bottles at the rock.
content.location: To the right of the broccoli mural on the Nest D boulder under the roof

content.description: Sit start with hands on the rail and climb the thin staircase
content.protection: Use a pad to cover the fin of rock at the landing
content.location: The Nest B, on the back side of the front boulder

content.description: Begin on the far left side of the boulder and reach right towards the center of the face. Climb up and top out at the pointy apex.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gFrvp5f96qc
content.location: In Nest B on a smaller rock face across from the main boulder.

content.description: Start standing with hands on both aretes, and squeeze your way up until you can make a big right hand move to a large edge.  Doing a sit start from a left sidepull around the arete adds an extra 2-3 moves, but doesn't really change the difficulty.  Watch out for a sharp crystal midway up the left arete.
content.protection: 1-2 crashpads.  Landing zone is on a hill, and it's easy to barndoor off the arete.
content.location: Follow the trail all the way to the end where it crosses onto private property, and the Excalibur boulder will be uphill on your left.

content.description: Sit start with hands on the large rail and feet on small nubs of rock at ground level (may be covered by leaves). Work your feet up onto the rail and trust your shoes' friction to work your way up the slab to the top.
content.protection: Pad, spotter to keep you from rolling down the hill.

content.description: Starting at flakes and a small triangular foothold on the left side of the right face of the boulder, traverse the flakes towards the right arete of the boulder to the good foothold and the ear-shaped jug. Work up into a sidepull and make a big move up and left to a positive hold. Top out at the top of the fin.
content.protection: Sloping landing, best to have a spotter and at least one pad.
content.location: The right face of the Nest B

content.description: Highball with a protruding section at he base.Start standing on the large protruding foothold and reach to grab the flake. Move your feet up to the sloper line that stretches across the rock that is somehow always free of moss, and then the flake where the starting holds are. Use crimps to gain the lip at the top.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a spotter preferred. I have seen people use a rope.
content.location: The tall section of the Nest B boulder

content.description: Step up to the left end of the flake, and follow it right through the crescents to good jugs.
content.protection: Several pads and a spotter, or just set up a top rope.
content.location: Middle of the Nest B boulder.

content.description: Enter a description of this area.
